Authors:
Haixia Ma, Zikun Song, Xiaoyan Pan, Yu Li, Zhanen Yang, Zhi
Qu
Title:
Multi-Gene phylogeny and taxonomy of Hypoxylon (Hypoxylaceae,
Ascomycota) from China
Keywords:
Ascomycota; molecular phylogenetics; wood-decomposing
fungi; tropical rainforest; taxonomy
Abstract:
The Hypoxylon species play an important ecological role in
tropical rainforest as wood-decomposers, and some might have benefical
effects for their hosts as endophytes. The present work concerns a
survey of the genus Hypoxylon from Hainan Tropical Rainforest National
Park of China. Four new species, viz. H. wuzhishanense, H. hainanense,
H. chrysalidospora, and H. cyclobalanopsidis, were discovered based on a
combination of morphological characters and molecular data. Hypoxylon
wuzhishanense is characterized by rust, pulvinate stromata, amyloid
apical apparatus, brown ascospores, most of perispore indehiscent in 10%
KOH. Hypoxylon hainanense has effused-pulvinate and violet stromata,
amyloid apical apparatus, light brown to brown ascospores with straight
germ slit, perispore dehiscent. Hypoxylon chrysalidospora is
distinguished by glomerate to pulvinate stromata, inamyloid apical
apparatus highly reduced or lacking, light brown to brown ascospores
with very conspicuous coil-like ornamentation. Hypoxylon
cyclobalanopsidis has pulvinate stromata Livid Purple, amyloid apical
apparatus highly reduced, faintly bluing, brown ascospores, perispore
dehiscent, and grows on dead branches of Cyclobalanopsis. Detailed
descriptions, illustrations, and contrasted to morphologically similar
species are provied. Phylogenetic analyses inferred from ITS, RPB2, LSU
and β-tubulin sequences confirmed that the four new species are distinct
within the genus Hypoxylon.
